snippet.title: Sticky Web: Science ponders Internet 'addiction'
snippet.description:
* Three years ago I wrote an "Idiot's Guide to Video Games," an article that explored the skyrocketing appeal of the $10 billion-a-year electronic gaming industry. With little previous experience, I played every major game system for two months -- racing cars in exotic locales with Mario and his Nintendo friends, thumbing a Gameboy on subway and taxi...
http://www.cnn.com/2006/TECH/internet/12/24/internet.addiction/index.html

snippet.title: Junk mail tsunami coming to swamp your inbox
snippet.description:
* IDG If you think its frustrating sifting throughenvelopes disguised as paychecks andpersonal correspondence to get to thatletter from your mother, just wait. Amarketing tsunami is heading toward theNet, and its going to swamp your inbox.
http://www.cnn.com/TECH/computing/9811/23/junkmail.idg/index.html

snippet.title: Internet project may help AIDS patients find better treatments faster
snippet.description:
* WebMD Imagine that youre infected with a deadly virus that eventually will kill you. Medical scientists have been unable to find a cure for your infection.
http://www.cnn.com/HEALTH/AIDS/9907/12/aids.internet/index.html

snippet.title: From snail mail to 4G, China celebrates 20 years of Internet connectivity
snippet.description:
* "Across the Great Wall we can reach every corner of the world," read the header of the first email sent from China back in 1987.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/23/world/asia/china-internet-20th-anniversary/index.html

snippet.title: How some colleges are offering free textbooks
snippet.description:
* College student Caitlin Ryen works two jobs to support herself and pay tuition at South Florida Community College. When a new semester rolls around, that usually means choosing which textbooks to buy, or not buying any at all, she says.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/living/open-textbooks-online-education-resources/index.html

snippet.title: History knows many searches akin to missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370
snippet.description:
* With each day, the hunt for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 becomes one of the most baffling mysteries of the modern era, but history offers many great quests in which mankind searched for something or someone lost.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/05/us/mankinds-great-searches-malaysia-airlines-plane/index.html

snippet.title: Unexplored angles of the missing plane
snippet.description:
* Today on CNN’s Reliable Sources hosted by Brian Stelter, media reporter at the Washington Post, Erik Wemple, spoke to Stelter about the wall-to-wall coverage on cable this week about Malaysia Flight 370. Jahabar Sidiq, CEO and editor of The Malaysian...
http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2014/03/23/unexplored-angles-of-the-missing-plane/

snippet.title: What I'm reading: Why would Obama administration do this?
snippet.description:
* By Fareed Zakaria “The Internet is often described as a miracle of self-regulation, which is almost true. The exception is that the United States government has had ultimate control from the beginning,” writes L. Gordon Crovitz in the Wall Street...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2014/03/24/what-im-reading-why-would-obama-administration-do-this/
